privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This website (greyfourt.github.io) respects your privacy. This page explains what data is collected, why, and what your rights are under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and French law.
privacy.controllerText: The data controller for this site is NazlÄ± Ã–zÃ§ubukÃ§uoÄŸlu, based in Lyon, France. For any privacy-related questions, you can reach out at:
privacy.analyticsText1: This site uses Matomo, a privacy-focused, self-hosted analytics tool, to understand how visitors use the site (page views, traffic sources, device types, etc.).
privacy.analyticsText2: Matomo is hosted on our own infrastructure (matomo.nas.dewwwe.com). No analytics data is sent to any third-party service. Matomo is only activated if you explicitly accept cookies via the consent banner.
privacy.analyticsText3: If you decline cookies, no analytics data is collected and no Matomo scripts are loaded.
privacy.legalBasisText: The legal basis for analytics data processing is your consent (Article 6(1)(a) of the GDPR). You can withdraw your consent at any time by clearing your browser cookies.
privacy.dataIntro: When you accept cookies, the following data may be collected anonymously:
privacy.dataItem1: Pages visited and time spent on each page
privacy.dataItem2: Approximate geographic location (country and city level, based on IP)
privacy.dataItem4: Device type (desktop, mobile, tablet) and screen resolution
privacy.dataItem6: Date and time of your visit
privacy.dataNote: No personally identifiable information (name, email, exact IP address) is collected or stored. IP addresses are anonymized before storage.
privacy.cookiesIntro: This site uses the following cookies:
privacy.cookieConsent: cookie-consent â€” Stores your cookie consent choice (accept/decline). Duration: persistent (localStorage). Set by this website.
privacy.cookieMatomo: Matomo cookies (_pk_id, _pk_ses) â€” Used for anonymous visit tracking. Duration: 13 months (_pk_id), 30 minutes (_pk_ses). Only set if you accept analytics.
privacy.cookiesText: No advertising, marketing, or third-party tracking cookies are used on this site.
privacy.retentionText: Analytics data collected by Matomo is retained for a maximum of 26 months, after which it is automatically deleted. Your cookie consent preference is stored locally in your browser and is not transmitted to any server.
privacy.thirdPartyText1: Google Fonts â€” The Nunito font is loaded via Next.js font optimization, which self-hosts the font files. No requests are made to Google servers.
privacy.thirdPartyText2: GitHub Pages â€” This site is hosted on GitHub Pages. GitHub may collect technical logs (IP addresses) as part of their hosting service. See GitHub's privacy statement for details.
privacy.transferText: As this site is hosted on GitHub Pages (USA), some technical data may be transferred outside the EU. GitHub complies with applicable data protection frameworks.
privacy.rightsIntro: Under the GDPR, you have the right to:
privacy.rightAccess: Access â€” Request a copy of any personal data we hold about you
privacy.rightRectify: Rectification â€” Request correction of inaccurate data
privacy.rightDelete: Erasure â€” Request deletion of your data
privacy.rightRestrict: Restriction â€” Request limitation of data processing
privacy.rightPortability: Portability â€” Request your data in a portable format
privacy.rightObject: Object â€” Object to data processing at any time
privacy.rightsText: Since we do not collect personally identifiable information, there is typically no personal data to retrieve. However, you may exercise any of these rights by contacting us at the email above.
privacy.cnilText: If you believe your data protection rights have been violated, you have the right to file a complaint with the CNIL (Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des LibertÃ©s), the French data protection authority:

problemDescriptions: With busy lifestyles and jam-packed schedules, it's easy to overlook the needs of our furry and leafy friends. Against the daily grind, even crucial tasks like vet appointments, pet food refills, and plant watering can fall by the wayside. This unintentional neglect can have serious consequences for our beloved companions - or as we call them floofs.

Here is our take, your one-stop solution for managing pet and plant care. This PWA mobile app seamlessly integrates into your daily routine, keeping track of important information, setting reminders, and sharing it all with our friends & family to ensure the well-being of your furry and leafy friends.
So, the Floof app was born!
projectCaseStudy.researchDescription: We've done our homework, extensively analyzing existing pet and plant care apps to understand their strengths and limitations. We've also gathered feedback from pet owners and plant enthusiasts to identify their pain points.
projectCaseStudy.brandDescription: We wanted the Floof App to have a personality that was both playful and sophisticated. We chose a color palette that was both vibrant and calming, and we designed a logo that was both cute and stylish.
projectCaseStudy.userJourneyDescription: We created detailed user journeys to make sure that every step of using the Floof App was intuitive and enjoyable. We wanted to make sure that the app was easy to use for people of all ages and skill levels.
outComeDescriptions: The Floof App is currently in development, but we're already making great progress. We're focusing on the mobile platform because we know that's where our users are spending most of their time.
We're constantly brainstorming new features for the Floof App.
The Floof App is not just a tool for managing pet and plant care; it's a companion for life. It's the perfect way to make sure that your furry and leafy friends are always happy and healthy.

problemDescriptions: As crochet lovers, we are always in search of new and exciting patterns. But sometimes, we come upon some terms or acronyms that we do not recognize quickly.
We want to have sneak peeks to all stitches while we are building our patterns.
So the Knotbook app is born!
projectCaseStudy.researchDescription: Swarmed the internet, tested and played around with many applications.
projectCaseStudy.brandDescription: We wanted to create an environment that users will not have a lot of distractions while keeping the cozy side.
projectCaseStudy.userJourneyDescription: We created detailed user journeys to guide us throughout design and development. Due to the complicated flows in the application, we created detailed diagrams for the development.
outComeDescriptions: Focused only on the mobile as our users would only need a on-the-go solution. Started with the simplest wireframes. Created designs from the basic - minimally styled MVPs to more studied designs.
